about_the_game:
A special kind of Jump-and-Run game in honor to the classics from the 80s home computer era. Our hero, little Nina, has been trapped into a large cave with multiple levels - you can help her to escape from there. In every level, there is a teleporter that moves Nina to the next level. Those teleporters work from batteries - so you have to collect all batteries in a level to avtivate the end level teleporter to escape from that level.

There are numerous hazards in every level: poisonous spiders dangling from the ceilings, pools filled with deadly liquids (water, slime, lava), flying balls that send out electrical shock bolts, evil people chasing Nina. Movement is done by walking, running and jumping, also climbing walls and ladders. There are lift platforms (moving horizontal and vertical), in-level teleporters that need coins to operate, and electrical forcefields that block passageways.

You can play either alone, or party up with friends or family and play locally with up to 4 players in a game (coop mode). There is no "points counting", so no rivalry is needed. But all players have to complete a level to count it "done". So it is "play together", and not "who wins the game".
detailed_description:
A special kind of Jump-and-Run game in honor to the classics from the 80s home computer era. Our hero, little Nina, has been trapped into a large cave with multiple levels - you can help her to escape from there. In every level, there is a teleporter that moves Nina to the next level. Those teleporters work from batteries - so you have to collect all batteries in a level to avtivate the end level teleporter to escape from that level.

There are numerous hazards in every level: poisonous spiders dangling from the ceilings, pools filled with deadly liquids (water, slime, lava), flying balls that send out electrical shock bolts, evil people chasing Nina. Movement is done by walking, running and jumping, also climbing walls and ladders. There are lift platforms (moving horizontal and vertical), in-level teleporters that need coins to operate, and electrical forcefields that block passageways.

You can play either alone, or party up with friends or family and play locally with up to 4 players in a game (coop mode). There is no "points counting", so no rivalry is needed. But all players have to complete a level to count it "done". So it is "play together", and not "who wins the game".
name: Ninas Escape

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Core i5, 4 cores
  • Memory: 16 MB RAM
  • Graphics: every recent Nvidia graphics card
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Sound Card: any windows supported sound card
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Core i5, 8 cores
  • Memory: 32 MB RAM
  • Graphics: Geforce RTX3060
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 6 GB available space
  • Sound Card: any windows supported sound card

short_description: Help litte Nina to escape from a multitude of levels, containing platforms, ladders, lifts, deadly pools of water, slime and lava. Avoid spiders, evil people, rolling boulders, electric barriers, Forcefields and much more. You can play alone or locally with up to 4 people in a network session.
